guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body: Why do you place more weight on what the anonymous writer of Hebrews says than what Jesus said? And this about *God* judging people, not us.

body:
I think it is relevant to know what the pop journalists are saying about religion & God. 

I think no one is particularly surprised, either. So, I do not think of this necessarily as even being offended.

body:
> "anonymous writer of Hebrews" 

> Hebrews is literally in the Bible, God's word

> 2 Tim 3:16: "All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness"

The Bible doesn't contradict itself because it is the word of God.
body_html:
"anonymous writer of Hebrews"

Hebrews is literally in the Bible, God's word

2 Tim 3:16: "All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness"

The Bible doesn't contradict itself because it is the word of God.

body:
Who told you the bible was God's word? Be careful and check your sources on that. The bible was compiled in 382 AD by the catholic church, Paul did not write 2 Timothy and "scriptures" at the time it was written referred only to the old testament, not Hebrews. You should be aware, however, that God *did* warn this, and you can find it in the bible itself at Jeremiah 8:8:

"How can you say, 'we are wise, and ê§âê§Ñê§Öê§Ñ's law (Torah) is with us' when in reality the deceitful pen of scribes has lied?!"

And the bible absolutely does contradict itself, you have to make mindboggling reinterpretations to try and glue it all together.
body_html:
Who told you the bible was God's word? Be careful and check your sources on that. The bible was compiled in 382 AD by the catholic church, Paul did not write 2 Timothy and "scriptures" at the time it was written referred only to the old testament, not Hebrews. You should be aware, however, that God did warn this, and you can find it in the bible itself at Jeremiah 8:8:

"How can you say, 'we are wise, and ê§âê§Ñê§Öê§Ñ's law (Torah) is with us' when in reality the deceitful pen of scribes has lied?!"

And the bible absolutely does contradict itself, you have to make mindboggling reinterpretations to try and glue it all together.

post.title: Don Lemon's Comments on God Aren't Just Mind-Blowingly Stupid, They Are Highly Offensive

body:
No, polytheist, the various Bible canons as compiled and canonized doesn't claim themselves to be God's word and does indeed contain de facto, undeniable contradictions only a liar would deny. Like you. Of course, being a liar is a prerequisite for being a Christian. 

Hebrews is indeed anonymous and of historically disputed canonicity. And no, the personal letter 2 Tim. 3:16 is obviously not self-referential; it's referring to the Hebrew scriptures, and there wasn't even concept of a "Bible", a "New Testament", nor were the would-be individual manuscripts fully written. 

I'm also going to assume from your comment you aren't even Orthodox or Catholic so what's even your basis of canonicity?
body_html:
No, polytheist, the various Bible canons as compiled and canonized doesn't claim themselves to be God's word and does indeed contain de facto, undeniable contradictions only a liar would deny. Like you. Of course, being a liar is a prerequisite for being a Christian.

Hebrews is indeed anonymous and of historically disputed canonicity. And no, the personal letter 2 Tim. 3:16 is obviously not self-referential; it's referring to the Hebrew scriptures, and there wasn't even concept of a "Bible", a "New Testament", nor were the would-be individual manuscripts fully written.

I'm also going to assume from your comment you aren't even Orthodox or Catholic so what's even your basis of canonicity?

"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God.

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.
guild.name: Christianity

parent.body:
> "anonymous writer of Hebrews" 

> Hebrews is literally in the Bible, God's word

> 2 Tim 3:16: "All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness"

The Bible doesn't contradict itself because it is the word of God.

"anonymous writer of Hebrews"

Hebrews is literally in the Bible, God's word

2 Tim 3:16: "All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness"

The Bible doesn't contradict itself because it is the word of God.

The last thing you know how to do is have an honest debate about anything, you just like to whip your superiority complex out onto the table and then make nonsensical comments while patting yourself on the back over how intelligent you think you are. Go ahead, there's plenty of digital space left on the internet, even for you.

body:
>So you are either CrystalVupine or someone very much like them

I'm not, and we're not remotely the same. But whatever helps you cope.

>The last thing you know how to do is have an honest debate about anything

I sure do, but that could of course never happen with a Christian. Dishonesty and lying is intrinsic to your religion, and a prerequisite for its followers. But please, give me a single of those "other arguments" that never happened. You can't and you won't. The subject at hand was canonicity and scripture, so what is it you were objecting to? What's nyour basis of canonicity?

>while patting yourself on the back over how intelligent you think you are

No, my person is irrelevant to the subject at hand, so is yours. You have it completely backwards. Deflecting to the person and ad hominem is a common Christian tactic when "debating". One I'll happily avoid.

while patting yourself on the back over how intelligent you think you are

No, my person is irrelevant to the subject at hand, so is yours. You have it completely backwards. Deflecting to the person and ad hominem is a common Christian tactic when "debating". One I'll happily avoid.
